newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Qantas passenger growth rises in Oct.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Qantas passenger growth rises in Oct.

text.p: Qantas Airways Ltd said on Friday preliminary statistics for the month of October, 1996 showed domestic passenger growth was 3.5 percent on the same month in the previous year and 4.5 percent for the year to October, 1996.
The airline said its international passenger growth was 9.8 percent for the month and 8.1 percent for the year to date.

Qantas said revenue passenger kilometre (RPK) growth for the domestic market in October was 3.7 percent and 5.6 percent for the year while international RPK growth was 9.4 percent in October and 8.0 percent for the year.

However, revenue seat factor, which measures the percentage of seats filled with paying passengers, fell 1.8 percentage points to 79.4 percent for the domestic market in October and fell 0.2 percent to 70.8 percent for the international market.
Revenue seat factor fell 0.7 of a percentage point to 72.4 percent for the group overall in October and is 1.1 percentage points down for the year.
Month of October Year to date
